story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a beautiful and peaceful valley nestled in the heart of the Hindu Kush mountains. This valley was known as Bamian, and it was home to a kind and gentle people who lived in harmony with the land and with one another.

In this valley, there lived a young boy named Ali. Ali was a curious and adventurous boy, who loved to explore the hills and streams that surrounded his home. He was always seeking out new adventures and discovering hidden treasures in the mountains.

One day, while playing near a stream, Ali stumbled upon a small, golden box. He picked it up and dusted it off, and as he did so, a beautiful and mystical being appeared before him. It was a genie, who had been trapped inside the box for thousands of years.

The genie thanked Ali for freeing him, and as a reward, offered to grant him three wishes. Ali was overjoyed and quickly made his first wish: he wished for his mother to be the happiest and healthiest woman in the world. The genie granted his wish, and Ali's mother was filled with a newfound joy and energy.

For his second wish, Ali wished for peace and prosperity for the people of Bamian. The genie granted this wish as well, and the valley became a place of peace and plenty, where the people lived in harmony with one another and with the land.

Finally, for his third and final wish, Ali asked the genie to take him on a journey to see the wonders of the world. The genie agreed, and together they traveled to far-off lands, where Ali marveled at the beauty and diversity of the world.

But no matter where they went, Ali always remembered his home in Bamian, and the happy, peaceful life he had left behind. And so, when the genie finally granted Ali's third wish and returned him to his beloved valley, he was filled with gratitude and joy.

From that day on, Ali lived a long and happy life in Bamian, always grateful for the genie's gifts and the love of his family. And every night, as he drifted off to sleep, he would think of the genie and the adventures they had shared, and he would smile, knowing that he was truly home.

And with that, my dear son, it is time for you to close your eyes and drift off to sleep. May the magic of this bedtime story fill your dreams and bring you joy and peace, just as Ali found in the beautiful valley of Bamian. Goodnight, my dear one.
